channel.title: Webclient error
channel.description:
Hiya all,
Iam trying to make a webclient for my server but it kept saying:
classnotfoundexception: client.class
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/v7wl6d.png[/img]
I followed This tut :[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=336494.0]Ric's webclient tut[/url]
Also i made a jar when i double click on the jar that i made it complete works and also downloading the cache. Also When i run the.bat file(thats made from the jar) iget NONE errors!
I only get that error when i try to run it on my webclient.
Anyone knows how to fix that problem?
Thanks!
, Love 3009

item.title: Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @iBunnie iBunnie
item.description:
@iBunnie wrote:

Host Gushers:

i think it might be because you didnt jar correctly or didnt sign your files.

Very wrong. It would not egen execute if the files werent signed.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

i think it might be because you didnt jar correctly or didnt sign your files.

item.title: Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @iBunnie iBunnie
item.description:
@iBunnie wrote:

[quote=“Love 3009, post:1, topic:472045”]Hiya all,

Iam trying to make a webclient for my server but it kept saying:

classnotfoundexception: client.class

v7wl6d.png896×533

I followed This tut :Ric’s webclient tut

Also i made a jar when i double click on the jar that i made it complete works and also downloading the cache.
Also When i run the.bat file(thats made from the jar) iget NONE errors!

I only get that error when i try to run it on my webclient.

Anyone knows how to fix that problem?

Thanks!

,
Love 3009[/quote]
For webclients to work without issues like this you are going to need to download a 1.6 version of java, delete ALL your .class files within your client, recompile and re jarr. Its something about the newer java versions…im sure higher updates will have this fixed soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @T0rvascape T0rvascape
item.description:
@T0rvascape wrote:

for some reason i got this until i did it right.

Did you jar and sign the CLASS files?

Read full topic
